findings.title: Vulnerability where the token becomes locked indefinitely
findings.description: The `mint()` function lacks proper validation for the `_expiryDate` parameter when called by an onlyIssuer, allowing an issuer to unintentionally or maliciously lock a token permanently.

findings.title: Problems when using the dependency ERC721
findings.description: Using a version of the OpenZeppelin contracts from version 5 and above will create problems when using the dependency ERC721, as the project overrides _beforeTokenTransfer() to reject invalid transactions, but this function has been removed in newer versions.

findings.title: Problems when using the dependency Ownable and OwnableUpgradeable
findings.description: Using a version of the OpenZeppelin contracts from version 5 and above will create problems when using the dependency `Ownable` and `OwnableUpgradeable`, the `constructor()` and `initializer()` have changed in the newer version of the OpenZeppelin contracts.

findings.title: Highly centralized contracts
findings.description: The BonuzTokens and BonuzSocialId contracts have highly privileged roles with extensive control over the system, which can lead to centralization and potential security risks.

findings.title: Missing zero address check
findings.description: The contracts `BonuzSocialId.sol` and `BonuzTokens.sol` do not properly validate address parameters against a zero address `(0x0)` check, which could lead to the assignment of a zero address.

findings.title: Floating Pragma - Info
findings.description: The project uses floating pragmas which may result in contracts being deployed using a wrong pragma version, different from the one they were tested with.
